text: Félix de Roy (25 July 1883 – 15 May 1942) was a Belgian astronomer, born in Antwerp. He observed and recorded more than 5,000 variable stars during his career. He was a member of the British Astronomical Association and directed its Variable Star Section between 1922 and 1939. He also occasionally observed meteors for the British Astronomical Association. ==References== Category:1883 births Category:1942 deaths Category:Belgian scientists Category:Belgian astronomers
title: Félix de Roy
